result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

addressed to: Adam J Westphal for hearing on November 2, 2022

Hearing on November 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

8:39 AM Defendant Adam J. Westphal in court, in custody.  Attorney Eryn M Menden in court for Adam J. Westphal.  Prosecuting attorney Melissa J. Zilavy in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court conducts a colloquy with the Defense.
The Defendant requests a prelim hearing.
The Court conducts a hearing:

Officer Grant Zabel, of the Village of Pewaukee Police Department, sworn in and testifies on direct by ADA Zilavy.
Cross examination by attorney Menden.
The witness is excused and the State rests.
The Defense rests with no testimony proffered.
The Court deems testimony closed.

The State moves for bind over.
The Defense objects to bind over.
Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.

Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Bail remains as fixed.
Hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 19, 2022 at 08:15 am.

records.descr: DE competent to stand trial, suspension lifted

records.addlTxt:
10:02 AM; Case called for Review hearing.  Defendant Adam J. Westphal in court, in custody.  Attorney Eryn M Menden in court for Adam J. Westphal.  Prosecuting attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court notes the matter is set for a review hearing on treatment to competency.  Atty. Menden confirms and notes a report has been filed advising the defendant is now competent to proceed.  She has received and reviewed that document, but notes she has not been able to review the report with her client.  Atty. Menden advises she is not contesting the finding of competency and both she and her client are ok with the Court vacating the suspension and proceeding in this matter.  State advises the ADA assigned has reviewed the report, do not contesting the findings, and they are asking the court to vacate the suspension and find the defendant is now competent to proceed.  Court confirms with Atty. Menden that even though she has not reviewed the report with her client she is comfortable with proceeding today.  Atty. Menden confirms she is comfortable with proceeding and making the Court making an official finding today even though she has not reviewed the report.  Court confirms with the defendant he has reviewed the most recent report.  Defendant advises he has not reviewed the most recent report.  Court believes the matter should be adjourn to allow time for Defendant to review the report with Atty. Menden.  Defendant wants to proceed.  Atty. Menden presents statements and notes her client wants the court to proceed with a finding he is competent to proceed, reopen the matter and is be set for preliminary hearing.  State has no objection.  Court will find based on the most recent competency report, as well as there being no objection to the findings by the State or Defense, that the defendant is now competent to proceed.  Court will lift the stay, resume the proceedings, but will reserve the right at the next hearing to re-address the court's ruling to resume proceedings if needed or requested. Court reminds the defendant he has the right to challenge the results in the report.  Defendant is aware and is not challenging the results.  Preliminary Hearing requested. PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 08:15 am.
filed, to be produced from Wisconsin Resource Center for the 10/10/2022 Review Hearing.
Updated report on Treatment to Competency by Dr. Pankiewicz filed with Cover Sheet for Confidential Records.
Review hearing on October 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.

11:24 AM; Case called for Review hearing.  Defendant Adam J. Westphal in court by Zoom video means, in custody at Wisconsin Resource Center, with attorney Eryn M Menden.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Jack Reider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Court notes at the last review hearing Atty. Menden needed additional time to review the report, filed on 7/7/22, with her client.  Atty. Menden confirms she as reviewed the report with her client and there is no objection to Dr. Sanchez's findings.  State advises they do not object to the findings as well.  Court will find that the defendant is still not competent but likely to become competency with treatment.  Court will continue to have this matter suspended and will set the matter over in 90 days for another review of treatment to competency.  Defendant to appear by Zoom video from Wisconsin Resource Center for the next court date.  Review hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Review hearing on August 5, 2022 at 11:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Adam J. Westphal
Current: P.O. Box 16, c/o Wisconsin Resource Center, Winnebago, WI 54985 United States  (Effective: 07-11-2022)
Prior: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States

09:41 AM; Case called for Review hearing.   Attorney Eryn M Menden in court.   Defendant Adam J. Westphal did not appear.   Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court inquires if Atty. Menden knows where the defendant is, as our jail advises us he is out.  Atty. Menden advises the defendant is now at WRC (Wisconsin Resource Center).  Atty. Menden advises that she has not had a chance to review the report with her client, but she is in agreement with the findings that the defendant needs additional treatment.  Atty. Zilavy confirms she has reviewed the report and also agrees with the finding that the defendant needs additional treatment.  Atty. Menden requests another review hearing in about 90 days.  Atty. Zilavy believes there should a review hearing sooner than 90 days.  Court will adjourn for continued review hearing the first week of August to allow time for Atty. Menden to review the report with her client.  Defendant to appear by Zoom video from WRC for the next court date.  Review hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Filed by Sergio Sanchez, Psy.D.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency) signed by Judge Laura Lau 04/11/2022.
Review hearing on July 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.

09:05 AM; Case called for Review hearing.  Defendant Adam J. Westphal in court, in custody at Waukesha County Jail, with attorney Eryn M Menden.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court confirms with counsel they have received and reviewed the competency evaluation report.  Court notes the doctor found the defendant to be not competent but likely to become competent.  Defense is in agreement with the findings.  State is in agreement with the findings.  Court will find there is probable cause in the criminal complaint.  Court will find the defendant not competent but likey to regain with treatment.  Court will also order that mediations be administered regardless of defendant's consent.  Court will note defendant got agitated and was removed from the courtroom before a new date was given.  Court will adjourn for review hearing in about 90 days.  Review hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Proposed Order for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with victim A/witness B listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed, CBD products or vape products.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.  If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.

DEFENSE COUNSEL REQUESTS ORDER FOR COMPETENCY PURSUANT TO SEC.. 971.14(2).  Court grants request and orders the defendant be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  To be done as an outpatient basis within 30 days.  Review hearing scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
